Item.Name: Yeast
Item.Description: Used to make the wine GO! w00tw00t!!

Item.Name: Oak Chips
Item.Description: Readily available in several types and toast levels. Easy to rack wine off of chips or beans. Used to add tannins to the wine during fermentation. +Tannin +oak taste

Item.Name: Oak Powder
Item.Description: Because of the surface area that comes in contact with the wine, a little bit a long way. Used to add tannins to the wine during fermentation. ++Tannin +oak taste

Item.Name: Oak Barrels
Item.Description: Traditional time-proven method for oaking large quantities of wine. dish, ++Tannin ++Oak taste

VineGrape.Name: Albariño
VineGrape.Description: Albariño is a variety of white wine grape grown in Galicia (northwest Spain), It presumably brought to Iberia by Cluny monks in the twelfth century.

VineGrape.Name: Albariño
VineGrape.Description: Albariño is a variety of white wine grape grown in Galicia (northwest Spain), It presumably brought to Iberia by Cluny monks in the twelfth century.

VineGrape.Name: Cataratto
VineGrape.Description: Catarratto is Italian white wine grape planted primarily in Sicily where it is most widely planted grape.

VineGrape.Name: Cataratto
VineGrape.Description: Catarratto is Italian white wine grape planted primarily in Sicily where it the most widely planted grape.

VineGrape.Name: Airén
VineGrape.Description: Airén is a variety of Vitis vinifera, a white grape commonly used in winemaking. grape is native to Spain where it represents about 30% of all grapes grown.

VineGrape.Name: Airén
VineGrape.Description: Airén is a variety of Vitis vinifera, a white grape commonly used in winemaking. grape is native to Spain where it represents about 30% of all grapes grown.

VineGrape.Name: Chardonnay
VineGrape.Description: Chardonnay is a green-skinned grape variety used in the production of white wine. variety originated in the Burgundy wine region of eastern France, but is now grown wherever wine is produced, from England to New Zealand

VineGrape.Name: Chardonnay
VineGrape.Description: Chardonnay is a green-skinned grape variety used in the production of white wine. The variety in the Burgundy wine region of eastern France, but is now grown wherever wine is produced, from England to New Zealand

VineGrape.Name: Chenin Blanc
VineGrape.Description: Chenin blanc is a white wine grape variety from the Loire Valley of France.

VineGrape.Name: Chenin Blanc
VineGrape.Description: Chenin blanc is a white wine grape variety from the Loire Valley of France.

VineGrape.Name: Colombard
VineGrape.Description: Colombard is French white wine grape variety that is the offspring of Chenin blanc and Gouais. It is still among the permitted white grape varieties in Bordeaux wine

VineGrape.Name: Colombard
VineGrape.Description: Colombard is French white wine grape variety that is the offspring of Chenin blanc and Gouais blanc. is still among the permitted white grape varieties in Bordeaux wine

VineGrape.Name: Garganega
VineGrape.Description: Garganega is a variety of white Italian wine grape widely grown in the Veneto region of North East Italy, in the provinces of Verona and Vicenza. It is Italy's 6th most widely planted white grape

VineGrape.Name: Garganega
VineGrape.Description: Garganega is a variety of white Italian wine grape widely grown in the Veneto region of North East Italy, in the provinces of Verona and Vicenza. It is Italy's 6th most widely planted white grape

VineGrape.Name: Gewürtztraminer
VineGrape.Description: Gewürztraminer is an aromatic wine grape variety, used in white wines, and performs best in cooler climates. English, it is sometimes referred to colloquially as Gewürz, and in French it is written Gewurztraminer.

VineGrape.Name: Gewürtztraminer
VineGrape.Description: Gewürztraminer is an aromatic wine grape variety, used in white wines, and performs best in cooler climates. English, it is sometimes referred to colloquially as Gewürz, and in French it is written Gewurztraminer.

VineGrape.Name: Grillo
VineGrape.Description: Grillo also known as Riddu and Rossese bianco, is a white Italian wine grape variety withstands high temperatures and is widely used in Sicilian wine-making.

VineGrape.Name: Grillo
VineGrape.Description: Grillo also known as Riddu and Rossese bianco, is a white Italian wine grape variety withstands high temperatures and is widely used in Sicilian wine-making.

VineGrape.Name: Macabeo
VineGrape.Description: Macabeo is a white variety of wine grape used to make mildly acidic and young white wines.

VineGrape.Name: Macabeo
VineGrape.Description: Macabeo is a white variety of wine grape used to make mildly acidic and young white wines.

VineGrape.Name: Müller-Thurgau
VineGrape.Description: Müller-Thurgau is a white grape variety which was created by Hermann Müller from the Canton of Thurgau in 1882. It is a crossing of Riesling with Madeleine Royale.

VineGrape.Name: Müller-Thurgau
VineGrape.Description: Müller-Thurgau is a white grape variety which was created by Hermann Müller from the Canton of Thurgau in 1882. It is a crossing of Riesling with Madeleine Royale.

VineGrape.Name: Muscat
VineGrape.Description: The Muscat family of grapes include over 200 grape varieties belonging to the Vitis vinifera species that have been used in wine production and as raisin and table grapes around the globe for many centuries. Their colors ranges from white (such as Muscat Ottonel), to yellow (Moscato Giallo), to pink (Moscato rosa del Trentino) to near black (Muscat Hamburg).

VineGrape.Name: Muscat
VineGrape.Description: The Muscat family of grapes include over 200 grape varieties belonging to the Vitis vinifera species that have been used in wine production and as raisin and table grapes around the globe for many centuries. Their colors ranges from white (such as Muscat Ottonel), to yellow (Moscato Giallo), to pink (Moscato rosa del Trentino) to near black (Muscat Hamburg).

VineGrape.Name: Parellada
VineGrape.Description: Parellada is a white grape variety of Catalan origin specially grown in Catalonia. With Macabeu and Xarel·lo, is one of the three traditional varieties used to make the sparkling wine Cava, which is primarily produced in Catalonia.

VineGrape.Name: Parellada
VineGrape.Description: Parellada is a white grape variety of Catalan origin specially grown in Catalonia. With Macabeu and Xarel·lo, is one of the three traditional varieties used to make the sparkling wine Cava, which is primarily produced in Catalonia.

VineGrape.Name: Pinot Gris
VineGrape.Description: Pinot gris is a white wine grape variety of the species Vitis vinifera. Thought to be a mutant clone of the Pinot noir variety, it normally has a grayish-blue fruit, accounting for its name (gris meaning 'gray' in French) but the grapes can have a brownish pink to black and even white appearance.

VineGrape.Name: Pinot Gris
VineGrape.Description: Pinot gris is a white wine grape variety of the species Vitis vinifera. Thought to be a mutant clone of the Pinot noir variety, it normally has a grayish-blue fruit, accounting for its name (gris meaning 'gray' in French) but the grapes can have a brownish pink to black and even white appearance.

VineGrape.Name: Glera
VineGrape.Description: Glera is a white variety of grape of Slovenian origin, which was brought to the village of Prosecco from Slovenia's Karst region. Glera was, until 2009, mostly referred to as Prosecco. Glera is mainly grown in veneto area in italy near coneglianoa and valdobbiadene and is mainly used to produce white wine called Prosecco.

VineGrape.Name: Glera
VineGrape.Description: Glera is a white variety of grape of Slovenian origin, which was brought to the village of Prosecco from Slovenia's Karst region. Glera was, until 2009, mostly referred to as Prosecco. Glera is mainly grown in veneto area in italy near coneglianoa and valdobbiadene and is mainly used to produce white wine called Prosecco.

VineGrape.Name: Riesling
VineGrape.Description: Riesling is a white grape variety which originated in the Rhine region of Germany. Riesling is an aromatic grape variety displaying flowery, almost perfumed, aromas as well as high acidity. It is used to make dry, semi-sweet, sweet, and sparkling white wines. Riesling wines are usually varietally pure and are seldom oaked.

VineGrape.Name: Riesling
VineGrape.Description: Riesling is a white grape variety which originated in the Rhine region of Germany. Riesling is an aromatic grape variety displaying flowery, almost perfumed, aromas as well as high acidity. It is used to make dry, semi-sweet, sweet, and sparkling white wines. Riesling wines are usually varietally pure and are seldom oaked.

VineGrape.Name: Sauvignon Blanc
VineGrape.Description: Sauvignon blanc is a green-skinned grape variety that originates from the Bordeaux region of France. The grape most likely gets its name from the French words sauvage ('wild') and blanc ('white') due to its early origins as an indigenous grape in South West France.

VineGrape.Name: Sauvignon Blanc
VineGrape.Description: Sauvignon blanc is a green-skinned grape variety that originates from the Bordeaux region of France. The grape most likely gets its name from the French words sauvage ('wild') and blanc ('white') due to its early origins as an indigenous grape in South West France.

VineGrape.Name: Sémillon
VineGrape.Description: Sémillon is a golden-skinned grape used to make dry and sweet white wines, mostly in France and Australia. Its thin skin and susceptibility to botrytis make it dominate the sweet wine region Sauternes AOC and Barsac AOC in France.

VineGrape.Name: Sémillon
VineGrape.Description: Sémillon is a golden-skinned grape used to make dry and sweet white wines, mostly in France and Australia. Its thin skin and susceptibility to botrytis make it dominate the sweet wine region Sauternes AOC and Barsac AOC in France.

VineGrape.Name: Torrontés
VineGrape.Description: Torrontés is a white Argentine wine grape variety, producing fresh, aromatic wines with moderate acidity, smooth texture and mouthfeel as well as distinctive peach and apricot aromas on the nose.

VineGrape.Name: Torrontés
VineGrape.Description: Torrontés is a white Argentine wine grape variety, producing fresh, aromatic wines with moderate acidity, smooth texture and mouthfeel as well as distinctive peach and apricot aromas on the nose.

VineGrape.Name: Trebbiano
VineGrape.Description: Trebbiano is an Italian wine grape, one of the most widely planted grape varieties in the world. It gives good yields, but tends to yield undistinguished wine. It can be fresh and fruity, but does not keep long.

VineGrape.Name: Trebbiano
VineGrape.Description: Trebbiano is an Italian wine grape, one of the most widely planted grape varieties in the world. It gives good yields, but tends to yield undistinguished wine. It can be fresh and fruity, but does not keep long.

VineGrape.Name: Viognier
VineGrape.Description: Viognier is a white wine grape variety. It is the only permitted grape for the French wine Condrieu in the Rhône Valley. Outside of the Rhône, Viognier can be found in regions of North and South America as well as Australia, New Zealand, the Cape Winelands in South Africa and Israel.

VineGrape.Name: Viognier
VineGrape.Description: Viognier is a white wine grape variety. It is the only permitted grape for the French wine Condrieu in the Rhône Valley. Outside of the Rhône, Viognier can be found in regions of North and South America as well as Australia, New Zealand, the Cape Winelands in South Africa and Israel.

VineGrape.Name: Xarel'lo
VineGrape.Description: Xarel'lo is a white grape variety of Spanish origin specially grown in Catalonia. With Macabeu and Parellada, is one of the three traditional varieties used to make the sparkling wine Cava.

VineGrape.Name: Xarel'lo
VineGrape.Description: Xarel'lo is a white grape variety of Spanish origin specially grown in Catalonia. With Macabeu and Parellada, is one of the three traditional varieties used to make the sparkling wine Cava.

VineGrape.Name: Cabernet Sauvignon
VineGrape.Description: Cabernet Sauvignon is one of the world's most widely recognized red wine grape varieties. It is grown in nearly every major wine producing country among a diverse spectrum of climates from Canada's Okanagan Valley to Lebanon's Beqaa Valley.

VineGrape.Name: Cabernet Sauvignon
VineGrape.Description: Cabernet Sauvignon is one of the world's most widely recognized red wine grape varieties. It is grown in nearly every major wine producing country among a diverse spectrum of climates from Canada's Okanagan Valley to Lebanon's Beqaa Valley.

VineGrape.Name: Carmenère
VineGrape.Description: The Carménère grape is a wine grape variety originally planted in the Médoc region of Bordeaux, France, where it was used to produce deep red wines and occasionally used for blending purposes in the same manner as Petit Verdot.

VineGrape.Name: Carmenère
VineGrape.Description: The Carménère grape is a wine grape variety originally planted in the Médoc region of Bordeaux, France, where it was used to produce deep red wines and occasionally used for blending purposes in the same manner as Petit Verdot.
